class_notes:
This course will be offered fully ONLINE and will meet synchronously for both sessions.
Permission code request form: http://bit.ly/QTM2021
This course is focusing on dependent variables for which models other than the linear regression model might be adequate. These include binary, polytomous nominal, categorical ordinal, counted, interval-valued, bounded continuous, censored, and truncated variables. This course discusses statistical methods for analyzing these dependent variables. The class will go through the models, interpretations, and testing for goodness-of-fit with examples so that students can choose the model and do the empirical analysis for various types of dependent variables that can appear in social science research.
course_description: Covers models for qualitative (count, binary, ordinal, or nominal) data, testing for goodness-of-fit, analyzing contingency tables, regression models for count, binary, and multiple categorical response data, etc.The Generalized Linear Models provide a unifying framework for the course.
prerequisites: QTM 220 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
